content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Burner inserter placed at the factory interface at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) (using direction RIGHT)
– An additional factory burner inserter retrieved at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5), which appears in the connection network

### Belt Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest deployed as the depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Dedicated transport belt segment placed adjacent at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter positioned next to the chest at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (using direction UP)
  
ERROR TIPS
──────────
• When connecting transport belts, avoid targeting a Prototype.SteamEngine. Repeated errors across Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, and 217 indicate that the target must be a valid inserter (or an appropriate intermediary) rather than a steam engine.
  
• When placing entities such as the wooden chest, ensure the target position is within the allowed range and that the required item is present in the inventory. Errors reported for placement at (3.5,15.5) (due to distance and missing item) emphasize the need to verify proximity and inventory content.
  
• Undefined variable errors (for example, the NameError for ‘target_chest’) highlight the importance of checking that all variable names are defined and correctly referenced before use.
